Syncing - files.list

The sync operation allows you to sync files from different folders, useful for creating files for a plugin in e.g. /content and having them moved to the plugin's content directory, ready for packaging.

Sync operations are specified by a file created in the root of a plugin's directory called files.list. You can specify to copy an entire directory or a single file to a destination path. You can use the following variables in paths:

Variable Usage
%LOCAL% Replaced with the root path of the current plugin.
%GLOBAL% Replaced with the root path of the CMS.
%TEMPLATES% Replaced with the path of the current plugin's template directory.
%CONTENT% Replaced with the path of the current plugin's content directory.

Example

// Line comments can be specified.
// The following below copies the file 'example.jpg' from the global content directory to a plugin's content directory:
%GLOBAL%/content/images/example.jpg, %CONTENT%/images/example.jpg

// The following below copies an entire directory:
%GLOBAL%/content/images/example/*, %CONTENT%/images/exmaple
